com.google.publicalerts.cap

Class CapUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.google.publicalerts.cap.CapUtil

  • public class CapUtil extends java.lang.Object
    Utilities for dealing with transforming to and from CAP protos.

    • Method Detail

      • getEnumValue

        public static java.lang.String getEnumValue(EnumValueDescriptor evd)
        Returns a CAP field value for an enum field.

        Enum values in proto use C++ scoping rules, so 2 enums of the same message can't have the same name. We work around this limitation by using the name Value_EnumTypeName

        Parameters:
        evd - the enum value descriptor
        Returns:
        a CAP field name for the enum field.

      • getEnumValue

        public static java.lang.String getEnumValue(ProtocolMessageEnum e)
        Returns a CAP field value for an enum field.

        Enum values in proto use C++ scoping rules, so 2 enums of the same message can't have the same name. We work around this limitation by using the name Value_EnumTypeName

        Parameters:
        e - the enum value
        Returns:
        a CAP field name for the enum field.

      • getElementName

        public static java.lang.String getElementName(FieldDescriptor fd)
        Returns the CAP element name given a proto FieldDescriptor.

        This method takes care of differences in casing between CAP and proto.

        Parameters:
        fd - the field descriptor for which the name is returned
        Returns:
        the element name of the field

      • findFieldByName

        public static FieldDescriptor findFieldByName(Builder builder, java.lang.String name)
        Returns a field descriptor for the field of the given builder with the given CAP name. Takes care of differences in casing between CAP and proto.
        Parameters:
        builder - the builder to search in
        name - the CAP name to search for
        Returns:
        the field, or null if it does not exist

      • getRepeatedFieldNames

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.util.Set<java.lang.String>> getRepeatedFieldNames()
        Returns a map of CAP fields to their child fields that may be repeated.

        For instance, an "info" can have repeated "category" and "msgType" fields, so both of those fields (and others) will be included in the set returned by getRepeatedFieldNames().get("info").

        Returns:
        a map of CAP fields to their child fields that may be repeated

      • isEmptyOrWhitespace

        public static boolean isEmptyOrWhitespace(java.lang.String s)
        Returns true if the string is null or s.trim() returns the empty string.
        Parameters:
        s - the string to check
        Returns:
        true if the string is empty or whitespace

      • isBased64

        public static boolean isBased64(java.lang.String s)
        Returns true if the string represents base64-encoded content, false otherwise.

        The input string cannot be null, but can be empty. In this case, the function would return true.

        The new-line character '\n' is stripped.

      • formatCapReference

        public static java.lang.String formatCapReference(java.lang.String capSender, java.lang.String capIdentifier, java.util.Calendar sent)
        Returns a string legal for use in a CAP <references> parameter.

      • formatCapReference

        public static java.lang.String formatCapReference(java.lang.String capSender, java.lang.String capIdentifier, java.lang.String sent)
        Returns a string legal for use in a CAP <references> parameter.

      • parseReferenceIdentifier

        public static java.lang.String parseReferenceIdentifier(java.lang.String s, int capVersion)
        Parses a CAP identifier from a single valid reference in <references>.

        Different parsing rules are applied according to the version of CAP being employed.

        If the input string is not compliant with the XSD schema, and parsing it is not possible, null is returned.

      • parseReferenceSent

        public static java.util.Date parseReferenceSent(java.lang.String s)
        Parses the date specified in a single valid reference in <references>.

        This method should be called only when parsing CAP feeds of version 1.1 or greater.

        If the input string is not compliant with the XSD schema, and parsing it is not possible, null is returned.

      • stripXmlPreamble

        public static java.lang.String stripXmlPreamble(java.lang.String xmlDocument)
        Strips the XML preamble, if any, from the start of the given string.
        Parameters:
        xmlDocument - document to check for <?xml ..> preamble. If a preamble exists, this method expects it to start on the first character of the given xmlDocument.
        Returns:
        the same String, minus any preamble.
